objects.name: EndScreenBestText
objects.string: You got the highest number of points!

events.comment:
This tab is the event sheet, which defines the logic of the game.
Some objects have behaviors that also perform logic and you can learn about those by reveiwing the extensions in this project.
Note: Keyboard controls are provided by the Platformer behavior automatically
Only move the player when the joystick is moved 40% away from center

events.name: Change animation based on what player is doing

events.comment: Trigger the sound and particle emitter on the 4th and 14th frame of the walking animation (to simulate footstep)
Reset all checkpoints. "Pick all" is required because the collision condition only picks the checkpoint touching the player.
Activate the checkpoint that the player is touching
Detect player falling below the screen
If player is dead, move back to spawn point
If player falls on enemy then enemy is defeated
Player always dies if the fire animation is showing

events.name: Use a  timer to set a boolean variable

events.comment: Timers must be started with an action

events.name: Change animation based on that boolean variable

events.comment: If player falls on enemy then enemy is defeated
Make player bounce up from fly (using a jump)
Disable the behavior that moved the fly up and down, add a downward force (90 degrees = down) and make fly rotate back and forth
When a Fly falls below background it is deleted. (This is just a good house keeping practice)
Start the game with the "EndScreen" layer hidden and make the overlay semi-transparent
Detect when the player reaches the door
Stop controlling player movement with platformer behavior and then use tweens to animate the player falling into the portal
Display appropriate text based on player score
Center objects and resize the overlay to cover entire screen
Animate text when mouse hovers over it
Background motion (parallax) and adjust size to fit screen
Increase volume of portal as the player gets closer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, axis force, trigger pressure, deadzone for each gamepad, etc...

Up to 4 gamepads can be connected. For each condition or expression, you'll have to enter the index of the gamepad to read. This is 1, 2, 3 or 4.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the force value of a gamepad stick.
0 is stick on default position, 1 is at the maximum.
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of axis of a gamepad stick.
eventsFunctions.name: AxisValue

eventsFunctions.description:
Test if a button is released on a gamepad. Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_released

eventsFunctions.description: Return the index of the last pressed button of a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonID

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Any_Button_pressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the last button pressed. 
Buttons for Xbox and PS4 can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Both: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonString

eventsFunctions.description:
Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad. 
Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of the deadzone applied to a gamepad sticks, between 0 and 1.
eventsFunctions.name: Deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Users can interact with the multitouch joystick to specify angle and force values.  These values can be used to control other objects in the scene such as movement and rotation, such as for twin-stick shooter games.

Mulitouch buttons can be used whenever a game allows the user to press multiple locations at once.

How to use:

- Add the joystick behavior to a sprite that will be the joystick 
- Place the joystick object on the scene
- Run the "Activate joystick" action on every frame and specify the thumb object
- The joystick thumb object will automatically be created and moved

Tips:

- Use "Simulate a touch" functions to provide mouse and gamepad controls
- More than one joystick or button can be used at the same time
- Joystick and thumb objects should have all sides the same length
- Thumb object must be smaller than the joystick object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MultitouchJoystick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Activate a joystick or buttons that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.

Calculate the percent of distance the thumb has moved from the center of joystick.

events.name: Move thumb based on joystick values

events.comment: Move thumb back to center when not being pressed (acts like a spring on a real controller)
Move joystick thumb when a touch is active
If floating is enabled, move joystick to keep touch inside
Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch (but stay inside joystick)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
A simple implementation of checkpoint and player spawnpoints. Give checkpoint objects the "Simple Checkpoint" behavior, and player objects the "Simple Checkpoint Player" behavior. Then, use the "Activate Checkpoint" and "Spawn Player" actions to activate the player and send them to their last location, respectively.

Saving to storage is also supported: either check the "auto-save spawnpoint" behavior property, or do so maually using the "Write/Read Spawnpoint" actions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Gives an object actions to interact with objects that have the checkpoint behavior. Spawnpoint can be set by using the "Activate checkpoint" action, and can then be saved/loaded automatically or manually by using the "Read/Write spawnpoint" actions.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
By default, movement will slow down when going around corners, but this can be changed to always use a constant speed.

Example uses:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Use constant speed (object will not slow down at corners)
- Use counter-clockwise direction

Tips:
- Set the CenterX and CenterY values to move the object
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- Use conditions to apply logic based on the direction the object is moving.  For example, setting the animation.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangularMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangularMovement

events.comment: Set the center of movement to the initial location of the object
Horizontal movement is the same for both methods
Vertical movement is reversed based on the parameter
Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Reset the counter after the rectangular path is completed
Vertical movement is the same for both methods
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if horizontal movement is disabled)
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if vertical movement is disabled)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
A drop-in replacement for the "Center the camera within bounds" action which supports smooth following.

 * __FollowSpeedX/Y__: Follow speed on an axis from 0 to 1, where 0 is the slowest and 1 is instant
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SimpleSmoothCameraFollow
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly have the camera follow an object on screen within limits.

eventsFunctions.description: Have the camera follow an object smoothly.
eventsFunctions.name: SmoothCameraFollow
eventsFunctions.sentence: Camera will follow _PARAM1_ smoothly with speed x: _PARAM2_, y: _PARAM3_ and between bounds (_PARAM6_, _PARAM7_), (_PARAM8_, _PARAM9_)

parameters: clamp(lerp(CameraX(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber")), Object.CenterX(), GetArgumentAsNumber("FollowSpeedX")), GetArgumentAsNumber("UpperLeftX") + CameraWidth(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber"))/2, GetArgumentAsNumber("BottomRightX") - CameraWidth(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber"))/2)

clamp(lerp(CameraY(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber")), Object.CenterY(), GetArgumentAsNumber("FollowSpeedY")), GetArgumentAsNumber("UpperLeftY") + CameraHeight(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber"))/2, GetArgumentAsNumber("BottomRightY") - CameraHeight(GetArgumentAsString("CameraLayer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("CameraNumber"))/2)

parameters.longDescription: Speed at which to follow the point in the X direction, from 0 to 1
parameters.name: FollowSpeedX

parameters.longDescription: Speed at which to follow the point in the Y direction, from 0 to 1
parameters.name: FollowSpeedY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Simple volume falloff based on distance from an object to another object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: VolumeFalloff

eventsFunctions.description: Set volume for a channel based on a falloff distance between two objects.
eventsFunctions.name: SetVolumeFalloff
eventsFunctions.sentence: Volume falloff on channel _PARAM1_ (type _PARAM2_) from _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ with volume from _PARAM5_ to _PARAM6_ starting at a distance of _PARAM7_ pixels

parameters: lerp(GetArgumentAsNumber("MinVol"), GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxVol"), max((GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxDistance") - DistanceBetweenPositions(Source.X(), Source.Y(), Target.X(), Target.Y()))/GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxDistance"), 0))

lerp(GetArgumentAsNumber("MinVol"), GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxVol"), max((GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxDistance") - DistanceBetweenPositions(Source.X(), Source.Y(), Target.X(), Target.Y()))/GetArgumentAsNumber("MaxDistance"), 0))

parameters.longDescription: Maximum distance before volume has completely fallen off in pixels.
parameters.name: MaxDistance
